availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry K. Osenton (Carter County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier)

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier. Married to Sciotha Osenton. Father of Lucy A. Osenton, Temperance Osenton, Josephes Osenton, Emza Osenton, Emely Osenton, William Osenton, John Osenton, and Elizabeth Osenton. Blacksmith in Carter County in 1850. Blacksmith in Carter County in 1860. Owned on enslaved person in Carter County in 1860. Served in Edward I. Wilson's Regiment of Kentucky Volunteers (U.S.A.).

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 244A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 265-6.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 249A.
